snippet: Lorine Cecere was married just last month, and the wedding pictures and honeymoon postcards from Tahiti still lie scattered on the kitchen counter of her mother's sprawling three-story house in the exclusive Emerald Bay enclave here.    She moved ...
lead_paragraph: Lorine Cecere was married just last month, and the wedding pictures and honeymoon postcards from Tahiti still lie scattered on the kitchen counter of her mother's sprawling three-story house in the exclusive Emerald Bay enclave here. She moved from the house so recently that the 28-year-old Mrs. Cecere still thinks of it as home. And so when fire roared through the canyon here on Wednesday, gobbling wooded acres and million-dollar houses, she and her husband, Vince, decided that they would do everything in their power to save it, no matter how foolhardy.

headline.main: Couple Races the Inferno, and Wins
